tip.title: Dempsey Roll
tip.description: The Dempsey Roll is a powerful combination of head movement and body rotation, popularized by Jack Dempsey. It allows the boxer to throw powerful hooks while evading punches.

tip.title: Corkscrew Punch
tip.description: The Corkscrew Punch, developed by Jack Johnson, involves rotating the fist during a punch to increase power and penetration. It's especially effective in close-range fighting.

tip.title: Left Hook to the Body
tip.description: The left hook to the body is a devastating punch aimed at the opponent’s ribs or liver. It can knock the wind out of them and set up other punches.

tip.title: Uppercut
tip.description: The uppercut is a rising punch aimed at the chin or body. It’s especially effective when delivered from close range and can knock out an opponent if landed cleanly.

tip.title: Right Cross
tip.description: The right cross is a powerful straight punch that comes from the rear hand. It is a key punch in a boxer’s arsenal, often following a jab to set up a knockout blow.

tip.title: Slip and Counter
tip.description: Slipping punches and then countering with a punch of your own is a crucial defensive technique. It involves moving your head off the centerline to avoid a punch while being in position to retaliate.

tip.title: Philly Shell
tip.description: The Philly Shell is a defensive stance popularized by Floyd Mayweather. It involves using the shoulder to block punches while positioning the hand for quick counters.

tip.title: Double Jab
tip.description: The double jab is an effective offensive move where the boxer throws two quick jabs in succession. This helps to control the distance and set up other punches.

tip.title: Check Hook
tip.description: The check hook is a defensive move used to counter an aggressive opponent by pivoting and landing a quick hook while moving backward.

tip.title: Overhand Right
tip.description: The overhand right is a punch thrown at an angle, coming down over the top of the opponent's guard. It's useful for landing power punches over an opponent's jab.
